    • areNounMappingsSimilar

      public static boolean areNounMappingsSimilar(NounMapping nm1, NounMapping nm2)
      Checks the similarity of two NounMappings.
      Parameters:
      nm1 - the first NounMapping
      nm2 - the second NounMapping
      Returns:
      true, if the NounMappings are similar; false if not.

    • isNounMappingSimilarToModelInstance

      public static boolean isNounMappingSimilarToModelInstance(NounMapping nounMapping, ModelInstance instance)
      Compares a given NounMapping with a given ModelInstance for similarity. Checks if all names, the longest name or a single name are similar to the reference of the NounMapping.
      Parameters:
      nounMapping - the NounMapping
      instance - the ModelInstance
      Returns:
      true, iff the NounMapping and ModelInstance are similar.

    • isWordSimilarToModelInstance

      public static boolean isWordSimilarToModelInstance(Word word, ModelInstance instance)
      Compares a given Word with a given ModelInstance for similarity.
      Parameters:
      word - the Word
      instance - the ModelInstance
      Returns:
      true, iff the Word and ModelInstance are similar.

      instance - the ModelInstance
      Returns:

      public static boolean isWordSimilarToModelInstanceType(Word word, ModelInstance instance)
      Compares a given Word with the type of a given ModelInstance for similarity.
      Parameters:
      word - the Word
      instance - the ModelInstance
      Returns:
      true, iff the Word and the type of the ModelInstance are similar.

    • areWordsSimilar

      public static boolean areWordsSimilar(Word word1, Word word2)
      Checks the similarity of two Words.
      Parameters:
      word1 - the first word
      word2 - the second word
      Returns:
      true, if the words are similar; false if not.

    • areWordsSimilar

      public static boolean areWordsSimilar(String word1, String word2)
      Checks the similarity of two string. Uses Jaro-Winkler similarity and Levenshtein to assess the similarity.
      Parameters:
      word1 - String of first word
      word2 - String of second word
      Returns:
      true, if the test string is similar to the original; false if not.

    • areWordsOfListsSimilar

      public static boolean areWordsOfListsSimilar(org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<String> originals, org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<String> words2test, double minProportion)
      Checks the similarity of a list with test strings to a list of "original" strings. In this method all test strings are compared to all originals. For this the method uses the areWordsSimilar method with a given threshold. All matches are counted. If the proportion of similarities between the lists is greater than the given threshold the method returns true.
      Parameters:
      originals - list of original strings
      words2test - list of test strings
      minProportion - threshold for proportional similarity between the lists
      Returns:
      true if the list are similar, false if not

    • areWordsOfListsSimilar

      public static boolean areWordsOfListsSimilar(org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<String> originals, org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<String> words2test)
      Checks the similarity of a list, containing test strings, and a list of originals. This check is not bidirectional! This method uses the areWordsSimilar method with a given threshold.
      Parameters:
      originals - list of original strings
      words2test - list of test strings
      Returns:
      true if the list are similar, false if not

    • getMostRecommendedInstancesToInstanceByReferences

      public static org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<RecommendedInstance> getMostRecommendedInstancesToInstanceByReferences(ModelInstance instance, org.eclipse.collections.api.list.ImmutableList<RecommendedInstance> recommendedInstances)
      Extracts most likely matches of a list of recommended instances by similarity to a given instance. For this, the method uses an increasing minimal proportional threshold with the method areWordsOfListsSimilar method. If all lists are similar to the given instance by a threshold of 1-increase value the while loop can be left. If the while loop ends with more than one possibility or all remaining lists are sorted out in the same run, all are returned. Elsewhere only the remaining recommended instance is returned within the list.
      Parameters:
      instance - instance to use as original for compare
      recommendedInstances - recommended instances to check for similarity
      Returns:
      a list of the most similar recommended instances (to the instance names)
